node.title: China banned Australian lobsters, but a smuggling operation worth $1.75m tried another way
node.alt: Three officials stand next to dozens of crates of lobsters.
node.description: There has been a surge in the import volume of Australian lobsters to Hong Kong following China's imposition of an unofficial banÂ last year.
node.content:
["Against the backdrop of trade sanctions on Australian lobsters, smugglers have been caught trying to take nearly 2,000 kilograms\u00a0of live lobster and sea cucumber into China.", "Hong Kong Customs officials said they seized\u00a0890 kilograms of live lobsters and 930 kilograms of sea cucumbers, with a total estimated value of 10 million Hong Kong dollars ($1.75\u00a0million).", "Two men aged 40 and 45 suspected to be connected to the case were also arrested, the statement added.", "Lui Siu-fai, the divisional commander of the city's\u00a0Syndicate Crimes Investigation Bureau, said the origin of the smuggled goods was\u00a0still under investigation and the\u00a0boxes were not labelled with a country of origin.", "", "
Hong Kong Customs says smuggling poses a threat to national security.(AP:\u00a0Kin Cheung)
", "The seized contraband was found aboard a double-engined speedboat trying to leave a harbour on the south of Hong Kong Island under the cover of darkness, he said.", "\"I believe that most of the smuggled goods were [to be]\u00a0shipped to mainland China,\" he said.", "
Blocking lobsters part of 'national security' drive
", "Lobsters are considered a delicacy in Chinese cuisine, and China had previously accounted for over 90 per cent\u00a0of Australia's lobster exports.", "But that changed in 2020, when diplomatic tensions saw Beijing impose a\u00a0series of unofficial trade hurdles on Australian produce.", "Exports of lobsters to Hong Kong then soared \u2014 Hong Kong and Australia have a separate free trade deal \u2014 with some of the live seafood finding its way to mainland cities.", "This is known as\u00a0\"grey trading\" \u2014 that is, when fishers export\u00a0the sanctioned goods first to a third country to circumvent a ban.", "The practice, which is not illegal, allows the goods to then be repackaged and delivered to the intended country.\u00a0", "", "
Australia is challenging China's trade measures at the World Trade Organization.(AP:\u00a0Kin Cheung)
", "The latest Customs seizure came\u00a0weeks after a similar anti-smuggling operation in October saw authorities seize 5,300 kilograms of Australian lobster\u00a0and arrest 13 people suspected to be connected to the case.", "Hong Kong Customs head\u00a0Louise Ho cited the crackdown on\u00a0alleged smuggling of Australian lobsters to the Chinese mainland as part of a mission to safeguard national security.", "\"On the face of it, it's just a normal smuggling case, smuggling lobsters. But actually, these smuggling activities would undermine the country's trade restrictions on Australia,\" she said.", "\"Therefore, tackling lobster-smuggling activities is an important task in safeguarding national security.\"", "China's lobster ban came after the Australian government pushed for an international investigation into the origins of COVID-19.", "China has since blocked other Australian imports including wine, barley, cotton and coal.", "Beijing's trade practices are being reviewed by the World Trade Organization, with Australia arguing they are inconsistent with WTO rules.", "Australia's ambassador to the WTO said last month that China had \"implemented trade disruptive measures\" which had ended Australia's exports of a dozen commodities, including lobster.", "Australia lobster exports to China, previously worth more than $720 million a year, had been \"significantly impacted following the General Administration of Customs China notification on 5 November 2020 they would be subjected to enhanced inspection\", a spokesperson for Australia's Trade Minister\u00a0Dan Tehan said.", "Australians are expected to be able to purchase half-price lobsters this Christmas, with Victorian lobsters expected to cost $70 per kilo compared to the usual $140, due to the Chinese market being closed to exports.", "ABC/wires"]
